newsitem.title: COLOMBIA: Colombia's stock exchanges to link electronically.
newsitem.headline: Colombia's stock exchanges to link electronically.

text.p: Colombia's three stock exchanges, Bogota, Medellin and Cali, will be linked electronically within the next two months in a bid to make its equities and fixed income markets more transparent and more competitive, a top regulatory official said Wednesday.
"The goal is to have the exchanges interconnected by June," Securities Superintendent Andres Uribe told Reuters.
He said the move would effectively create just one exchange in Colombia and end longstanding divisions and rivalries between brokers and other market players in the country's three leading cities.
"Operations will be unified and there should be more intermediaries and greater access to the market," Uribe said.
"Colombia is in the process of moving toward a unitary market," he added, saying this should lead, in turn, to "more volume and more clients."

Electronic trading was introduced on Colombia's exchanges last year but there is currently no link between various trading systems and technologies and each exchange operates independently of the others.
